block.p: Gabrielle Margaret Bushman, the daughter of Georgia Bushman of South Norwalk, Conn., and Gregory T. Bushman of New York, was married yesterday to David Acton Fitzgerald, a son of Dr. Thomas A. Fitzgerald Jr. of Lakewood, Colo., and the late Billie Jean Fitzgerald. The Rev. David M. Clarke performed the ceremony at St. Edmond's Roman Catholic Church in Rehoboth Beach, Del.

The bride, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a senior press officer at the United States Agency for International Development in Washington. Until 1996, she was a speechwriter and researcher at the White House. She graduated from American University and received a master's degree in public administration from Syracuse University. Her father, who works in Purchase, N.Y., is the director of business development for the United States subsidiary of Mitsui Chemicals, a Japanese manufacturer. Her mother is the manager of media and communications for Save the Children, the aid organization in Westport, Conn.

Gabrielle Margaret Bushman, the daughter of Georgia Bushman of South Norwalk, Conn., and Gregory T. Bushman of New York, was married yesterday to David Acton Fitzgerald, a son of Dr. Thomas A. Fitzgerald Jr. of Lakewood, Colo., and the late Billie Jean Fitzgerald. The Rev. David M. Clarke performed the ceremony at St. Edmond's Roman Catholic Church in Rehoboth Beach, Del.

The bride, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a senior press officer at the United States Agency for International Development in Washington. Until 1996, she was a speechwriter and researcher at the White House. She graduated from American University and received a master's degree in public administration from Syracuse University. Her father, who works in Purchase, N.Y., is the director of business development for the United States subsidiary of Mitsui Chemicals, a Japanese manufacturer. Her mother is the manager of media and communications for Save the Children, the aid organization in Westport, Conn.

Mr. Fitzgerald, 34, is a senior associate at Verner, Liipfert, Bernhard, McPherson & Hand, a Washington law firm. Until 1994, he was a legislative aide to Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum, Democrat of Ohio. The bridegroom graduated from Colorado College and received a law degree from the Catholic University of America. His mother was the director of corporate giving in the fund-raising office of the University of Denver. His father retired as the principal of the lower school at Colorado Academy, a private school in Denver.
The bridegroom is a great-grandson of the late mayor of Boston, John F. Fitzgerald, who was known as Honey Fitz and was President John F. Kennedy's maternal grandfather.
